glossary.heading: Learn about
glossary.description: Browse our extensive collection of trading definitions to better understand the financial markets.

term_1.name: ADI
term_1.text: ADI stand for Average Directional Index. This is used as a technical bareometer of the strength or weakness of trends in financial markets.

term_2.name: Anonymous Trading
term_2.text: Traders can opt not to disclose their identity while making offers or bids on the financial markets.

term_3.name: Appreciation
term_3.text: The increase in monetary value of any financial instrument in response to the market.

term_4.name: Arbitrage
term_4.text: The simultaneous purchase and sale of an asset in order to increase profits with minimal risks.

term_5.name: Ask Rate
term_5.text: The lowest price a seller is willing to sell a financial asset, also known as an offer.

term_6.name: Asset
term_6.text: The instrument that a contract is based upon. This could be a stock, bond, or commodity.

term_7.name: Asset Location
term_7.text: An investment strategy that aims to balance risk and reward by distribute a portfolio's assest according to a trader's goals and risk tolerance.

term_8.name: At the Money
term_8.text: This term refers to a trade breaking even, meaing their neither a profit or a loss.

term_9.name: Attorney in Charge
term_9.text: An individual authorized to make transactions on the financial markets on behalf of the trader.

term_10.name: Authorized Dealer
term_10.text: A certified entity that engages in foreign currency transactions.

term_11.name: Away from the Market
term_11.text: An expression used when a buy or sell price deviates from the assets market price.

term_12.name: Altcoin
term_12.text: This term refers to low market cap cryptocurrencies. It originated as a term to describe all cryptocurrencies 'alternative coins' other than bitcoin.

term_13.name: Aussie
term_13.text: A slang term for the AUD/USD currency pair.

term_14.name: Balance of Payments (BOP)
term_14.text: A record that tracks a country's transactions over a particular period of time.

term_15.name: Balance of Trade
term_15.text: The difference in value between a country's imports and exports over a particular period of time.

term_16.name: Bank Rate
term_16.text: The interest rate that the central bank of a country gives loans to domestic comercial banks.

term_17.name: Bar Charts
term_17.text: A common diagram used to study the price action of currency pairs.

term_18.name: Base Currency
term_18.text: A term used in trading Foreign Exchange. When quoting currency pairs, it is the first currency that you trade the secondary/quoted currency against. Example: EUR/USD - the Euro is the base currency, and the US Dollar is the quote currency.

term_19.name: Bear
term_19.text: An investor who believes that the price of a particular asset will fall and attempts to profit from a decline in stock prices.

term_20.name: Bear Market
term_20.text: The financial market in which asset prices are falling, encouraging selling.

term_21.name: Bid
term_21.text: The selling price of a specific financial asset.

term_22.name: Big Figure
term_22.text: The first two to three digits of a Foreign Exchange rate or price.

term_23.name: Blue Chip
term_23.text: Shares of well-established companies, considered to be a reliable investment.

term_24.name: Break Even
term_24.text: This is when there is no profit or loss experienced when making a transaction.

term_25.name: Bretton Woods Agreement
term_25.text: An agreement for an international monetary system. This agrement was signed in 1944 in the United States.

term_26.name: Broker
term_26.text: A person who buys and sells financial assets as a middleman between retail traders and established financial corporations.

term_27.name: Bull
term_27.text: An investor who believes that the price of a particular asset rise fall and attempts to profit from an increase in stock prices.

term_28.name: Bull Market
term_28.text: The financial market in which asset prices are rising, encouraging buying.

term_29.name: Block
term_29.text: A collection of data defining transactions that took place in a particular period of time. After being published, blocks cannot be changed and therefore are linked with other blocks to creat a chain of data.

term_30.name: Blockchain
term_30.text: A ledger of transactions made in cryptocurrencies that are recorded chronologically.

term_31.name: British Pound
term_31.text: A slang term for the Currency of the United Kingdom, short for the Sterling Pound.

term_32.name: Buy Limit Order
term_32.text: An order to buy a security at or below a specified price.

term_33.name: Call Option
term_33.text: An agreement that allows a buyer the option to buy a financial asset at a specified price with in a particular period of time. The buyer however is not obligated to purchase the asset.

term_34.name: CCI
term_34.text: CCI stands for Commodity Channel Index. This is a technical trading tool regularly used to measure when a financial instrument has been overbought or oversold.

term_35.name: CFD
term_35.text: CFD stands for Contract for Difference. This is a contract between an investor and an investment instituation. At the end of the contract, the parties involved exchange the monetary difference between the opening and closing prices of the financial instrument involved in the contract.

term_36.name: Commission
term_36.text: A fee paid to the brokerage firm that facilitated a transaction.

term_37.name: Commodities
term_37.text: This refers to raw materials including precious metals, oil, and coffee.

term_38.name: Commodity Pairs
term_38.text: The foreign exchange pairs that are highly correlated to commodity fluctuations in the global financial markets. These three pairs are USD/CAD, AUD/USD, and NZD/USD.

term_39.name: Counter Currency
term_39.text: A term used in trading Foreign Exchange. When quoting currency pairs, it is the second currency that you compare against the base currency.

term_40.name: CPI
term_40.text: CPI stands for Consumer Price Index. A statistical measurement that examines changes in the purchasing power of a currency and the inflation rate.

term_41.name: Cross Currency Transaction
term_41.text: A transaction that involves two or more currencies being traded at the same time.

term_42.name: Currency
term_42.text: A financial asset that can be traded, often in pairs.

term_43.name: Currency Trading
term_43.text: The exchange of one currency for another currency.

term_44.name: Centeralization
term_44.text: Any system that is controlled by trusted parties, such as banks or money transmitters. All financial assets other than cryptocurrency have a centralized market.

term_45.name: Cable
term_45.text: A slang term in Forex trading for the currency pair GBP/USD (British Pound vs. US Dollar).

term_46.name: Correlation
term_46.text: A statistical term for establishing a relationship between two or more independent assets.

term_47.name: Day Trading
term_47.text: This is when positions on the market are opened and closed on the same day, rather than holding the positions overnight.

term_48.name: Decentralization
term_48.text: Cryptocurrency has allowed for decentralization of the markets. Unlike all other financial assets, cryptocurrency does not need to be traded by a trusted party.

term_49.name: Deficit
term_49.text: This occurs when liabilities (losses) exceed assets (profits).

term_50.name: Demo Trader
term_50.text: An account that uses virtual money, allowing a potential investor to get acclimated to trading in the market before investing real money.

term_51.name: Depreciation
term_51.text: The decrease in monetary value of any financial instrument in response to the market.

term_52.name: Derivative
term_52.text: A financial contract with a value deriving from an underlying variable asset.

term_53.name: Dividend
term_53.text: A portion of a company's profits paid to shareholders on a regular schedule.

term_54.name: DAX
term_54.text: Germany's leading stock index is called Deutsche Atkien Xchange, or DAX for short.

term_55.name: Dealing Desk
term_55.text: This is where a dealer facilitates transactions.

term_56.name: Depth of Market
term_56.text: The volume of open buy and sell orders for a particular currency pair at a particular point in time.

term_57.name: Earnings Per Share (EPS)
term_57.text: The portion of a company's profits allocated to each share of common stock.

term_58.name: ECN Broker
term_58.text: ECN stands for Electronic Communication Networks. An ECN Broker is a financial expert that uses ECN's to allow clients direct access to the markets.

term_59.name: Expert Advisor
term_59.text: An automated trading robot within the trading platform that allows the analytical and trading processes to be carried out with limited manual control.

term_60.name: Expiry Time
term_60.text: The date and time when a trade involving a financial instrument expires.

term_61.name: European Central Bank (ECB)
term_61.text: The European Central Bank is responsible for the monetary policy of countries that have adopted the Euro as their currency.

term_62.name: Exotic
term_62.text: Exotic currencies are those that are less traded than the major currencies.

term_63.name: Federal Reserve
term_63.text: The central bank of the United States, responsible for overseeing the financial system of the country. This is the leading financial instituation in the world.

term_64.name: Fibonacci
term_64.text: A common technical tool used by analysts to identify potential levels of support and resistance based on key numbers.

term_65.name: Fill
term_65.text: The act of executing a transaction on a trading platform.

term_66.name: Financial Instrument
term_66.text: The asset that is used in a trade. This could be a stock, bond, or commodity.

term_67.name: Flat
term_67.text: This describes a situation when a trader does not have any running positions in the market.

term_68.name: Forex
term_68.text: A slang term for Foreign Exchange.

term_69.name: Fundamental Analysis
term_69.text: A method of market analysis used to evaluate related economic, financial and other qualitative and quantitative factors that affect the performance of a particular financial instrument.

term_70.name: Fiat
term_70.text: This is term used to describe traditional currencies as opposed to cryptocurrencies.

term_71.name: FUD
term_71.text: FUD is an acronym that stands for fear, uncertainty, and doubt. It is often used by traders to reference the negative attitude surrounding cryptocurrency.

term_72.name: Gap
term_72.text: The difference in value between the closing price of one trading period and the opening price of the following trading period.

term_73.name: GDP
term_73.text: GDP stands for Gross Domestic Product. It determines the total worth of a country's services and produced goods with in a particular time period, and is used to gauge the economic standing of a country.

term_74.name: GTC
term_74.text: GTC stands for Good Till Cancelled. This is an order to buy or sell a specific financial asset at a specific price, that is only valid until a trader chooses to cancel it.

term_75.name: Hedging
term_75.text: A strategy used in order to reduce risk of losses when trading in the financial markets.

term_76.name: In the Money
term_76.text: A phrase to describe a trader making a profit.

term_77.name: Index
term_77.text: A weighted average of preselected stock prices that is used to measure a section of the stock market. Some popular indices are the NASDAQ, Dow Jones, and S&P 500.

term_78.name: Inflation
term_78.text: A progressive increase in prices of goods and services within a country, which in turn reduces the purchasing value of that country's currency.

term_79.name: Interbank Rate
term_79.text: The interest rate on loans that one bank will offer to another bank.

term_80.name: Initial Margin
term_80.text: The first deposit a customer makes, which then determines their maximum trade size.

term_81.name: Initial Margin Requirement
term_81.text: The minimum amount for a deposit to enter a trade position.

term_82.name: Interest Rate
term_82.text: The fee paid for borrowing money. Interest rates fluxate as they are affected by Central Banks and inflation.

term_83.name: Introducing Broker
term_83.text: A broker with a direct relationship with the client, but delegates the transactions and trades to another broker.

term_85.name: Jobber
term_85.text: A term used for a trader who intends to make accumulated profits by opening and closing short-term positions.

term_86.name: Kill
term_86.text: An order that cannot be wholly filled in the market will be cancelled or killed.

term_87.name: Kiwi
term_87.text: A slang term for the New Zealand Dollar

term_88.name: Lagging Indicators
term_88.text: Statistics that change after trends in the economy have already started to change.

term_89.name: Leading Indicators
term_89.text: Statistics that help forecast a country's economic performance trends.

term_90.name: Leverage
term_90.text: A financial tool that allows an investor to magnify their market exposure beyond their initial capital.

term_91.name: Liquidity
term_91.text: The degree to which an asset can be bought or sold without affecting it's price.

term_92.name: Long
term_92.text: Opening a buy position in the market is referred to as 'going long'

term_93.name: Limit Order
term_93.text: A direction to buy or sell an asset a specified price or better.

term_94.name: Line Chart
term_94.text: A series of lines connecting multiple price levels over a particular time period.

term_95.name: Lot
term_95.text: The standard number of units required to trade a financial asset, as determined by the exchange.

term_96.name: Margin
term_96.text: The size of deposit needed to ensure the running positions in the market are kept active.

term_97.name: Margin Account
term_97.text: An account provided by brokers that allows investors to buy securities borrowed funds.

term_98.name: Margin Call
term_98.text: The requirement made by a broker that a trader makes an additional deposit to cover possible losses.

term_99.name: Market Maker
term_99.text: A brokerage firm that buys and sells financial assets to provide liquidity to the markets.

term_100.name: Market Price
term_100.text: The current price of a financial asset being traded in the market.

term_101.name: Mine and Yours
term_101.text: Terms used to describe the intention to buy or sell. 'Mine' is used when buying, and 'yours' is used when selling.

term_102.name: Money Market
term_102.text: A segment of the financial market involving transactions of financial assets with fast maturities and high liquidity.

term_103.name: Moving Acerage Convergence Divergence (MACD)
term_103.text: A technical indicator used to determine the trend of the market.

term_104.name: Miners/Mining
term_104.text: A miner's duty is to keep blockchains secure by confirming transactions and time-stamping entries.

term_105.name: Maximum Leverage
term_105.text: The largest amount of leverage available on the initial deposit.

term_106.name: MetaTrader4
term_106.text: The innovative trading platform used to provide brokerage services to traders in multiple financial assets.

term_107.name: Monetary Poilicy
term_107.text: The policy regarding interest rates and money supply put in place by the central bank of a particular country.

term_108.name: Moving Average
term_108.text: A technical indicator used to filter out the abnormalities to allow the focus to be on the statistical average of the original curve.

term_109.name: NASDAQ
term_109.text: The largest electronic stock exchange in the United States.

term_110.name: Noise
term_110.text: Abnormalities in the market that make it difficult to focus on the statistical averages used to make a trading decision.

term_112.name: NFP
term_112.text: Stands for Non Farm Payroll. A monthly report done by the United States Department of Labor, which is used to determine the status of the labor market, excluding farmers.

term_113.name: Net Position
term_113.text: The value of a position after subtracting the price of the initial investment.

term_114.name: News Trader
term_114.text: A trader who bases investment decisions on how global news announcements impact the markets.

term_115.name: NOK
term_115.text: The currency symbol for the Norwegian Krone.

term_116.name: NZD
term_116.text: The currency symbol for the New Zealand Dollar.

term_117.name: Open Order
term_117.text: A position that is running in the market until the trader chooses to close it.

term_118.name: Order
term_118.text: A request to a broker to perform a transaction of a financial instrument at a present price.

term_119.name: Out of the Money
term_119.text: A term used to describe a loss in trade.

term_120.name: Overnight Position
term_120.text: A position that is kept open until the following trading day.

term_121.name: Overtrading
term_121.text: The risky habit of engaging in excessive trading transactions without appropriate research.

term_122.name: Offer
term_122.text: The price set by a seller at which they are willing to sell.

term_123.name: Options
term_123.text: The opportunity, but not the obligation, to perform a transaction involving an asset.

term_124.name: Oscillators
term_124.text: Technical analysis tools using an indicator that fluctuates between overbought and oversold levels, used to express buy and sell signals.

term_125.name: One Cancels the Other Order (OCO)
term_125.text: Two transactions sunmitted at the same time, where the completion of one automatically cancels the other.

term_126.name: Payout
term_126.text: The total amount of earnings from a successful transaction.

term_127.name: PIP
term_127.text: Stands for Percentage In Point. The smallest unit of measurement used in Forex trading to determine exchange rates between multiple currencies.

term_128.name: Platform
term_128.text: The system used to perform transactions provided by a brokerage firm.

term_129.name: Price.Earnings Ratio (P/E)
term_129.text: The ratio used to value a company by comparing it's current share price to it's per share earnings.

term_130.name: Principal Value
term_130.text: The starting capital that a trader invests for transactions in the financial market.

term_131.name: Put Option
term_131.text: An agreement that allows a seller the option to sell a financial asset at a specified price with in a particular period of time. The seller however is not obligated to sell the asset.

term_132.name: Private Key
term_132.text: Electronic signature used to unlock cryptocurrency wallet and sign transactions.

term_133.name: Public Key
term_133.text: The cryptocurrency code given out when requesting a payment.

term_134.name: Pump and Dump
term_134.text: The process of inflating an assets value by purchasing a large quantity in the hopes that others will follow suit. Afterwords, the initial buyer will sell their assets in the hopes to make a profit from the inflated price.

term_135.name: Quantitative Easing
term_135.text: A method used by central banks to encourage economic growth. This is done by purchasing government securities in order to increase capital and liquidity in financial institutions.

term_136.name: Quote Currency
term_136.text: A term used in trading Foreign Exchange. When quoting currency pairs, it is the second currency that you trade against the first currency.

term_137.name: Quote
term_137.text: The most recent price a buyer and seller have agreed upon.

term_138.name: Rate
term_138.text: A rate/exchange rate is the compared price of one currency to another.

term_139.name: Rebate
term_139.text: The portion of interest or dividends on an asset that is returned to the investor at the end of a trade.

term_140.name: Relative Strength Index (RSI)
term_140.text: A technical indicator that measures if a financial instrument has been overbought or oversold.

term_141.name: Risk Capital
term_141.text: The size of a deposit that an investor is willing to risk.

term_142.name: Robot
term_142.text: Software that indicates when to open or close a position in the market.

term_143.name: رول أوفر
term_143.text: The act of swaping a matured contract prior to it's expiration date, with a new contract. The difference in price between the two contracts is adjusted.

term_144.name: Resistance
term_144.text: The price at which a financial asset peaks, before multiple investors decide to sell the asset.

term_145.name: Risk Management
term_145.text: One or more strategies used in order to reduce financial risk when trading in the financial markets.

term_146.name: Scalping
term_146.text: A strategy used by traders who make many small short-term transactions, looking to increase their profits with multiple small increments that can compound.

term_147.name: SEC
term_147.text: Stands for the US Securities and Exchange Commission.

term_148.name: Security
term_148.text: Any financial asset that can be traded.

term_149.name: Short
term_149.text: Opening a buy position in the market is referred to as 'going long'

term_150.name: Slippage
term_150.text: The price difference between an assets displayed value and the exact value when a transaction occurs.

term_151.name: Spot Price
term_151.text: The current price an asset can be bought or sold in the marketplace.

term_152.name: Spread
term_152.text: The difference in value between the ask price and the bid price of a financial asset.

term_153.name: Stochastic
term_153.text: An oscillating indicator used to determine the change in price of a financial asset from one closing period to the next.

term_154.name: Stock
term_154.text: A share in the ownership of a company and the respective assets and earnings.

term_155.name: Stop Loss Order
term_155.text: An order given by a broker to limit an investor's loss by making them sell when a security reaches a certain price.

term_156.name: Strike Price
term_156.text: An asset's value when it is purchased or sold.

term_157.name: SWAP
term_157.text: The process of exchanging value of one investor's assets with another investor's assets.

term_158.name: Security Exchange Commission (SEC)
term_158.text: U.S. government agency that regulates national securities industry, stock markets, and electronic securities agency.

term_159.name: Satoshi
term_159.text: Equivalent to the eighth decimal place, this is the smallest unit of bitcoin.

term_160.name: Sell Limit Order
term_160.text: The process of limiting the price on a transaction.

term_161.name: Sell Stop
term_161.text: An order for a limit order to become a market order once it falls below the current market price.

term_162.name: Short Position
term_162.text: Selling first and buying later to produce a profit or loss from the difference.

term_163.name: Spot
term_163.text: Taking the value of the current date and selling at that price, but settling in the following two days.

term_164.name: Sterling
term_164.text: A name for the British Pound (GBP), also called the pound sterling.

term_165.name: Stop-Buy
term_165.text: An order to buy when the currency price is above the current market.

term_166.name: تحاليل فنية
term_166.text: Studying past market data to influence future of financial instruments.

term_167.name: Trader
term_167.text: A person who invests in transactions on the markets.

term_168.name: Trailing Stop Loss
term_168.text: The ability to automatically adjust the limit price threshold to be closer to a more favorable market price.

term_169.name: Transaction Date
term_169.text: The moment when trading assets occurs.

term_170.name: Take Profit
term_170.text: A type of limit order that determines the specific price to close an open position in order to profit.

term_171.name: Trading Platforms
term_171.text: A software used by investors to trade forex.

term_172.name: Transaction
term_172.text: The process of exchanging goods, services, and financial assets between a buyer and a seller.

term_173.name: Trend
term_173.text: The general direction of the market.

term_174.name: Under-Valuation
term_174.text: If an exchange rate does not surpass it's purchasing power, it is considered undervalued.

term_175.name: Unemployment Rate
term_175.text: The rate of people in the workforce without jobs.

term_176.name: US Dollar
term_176.text: The currency in the United States of America

term_177.name: Value Date
term_177.text: The final settlement date decided by the parties involved in a financial deal.

term_178.name: Variation Margin
term_178.text: The extra amount of money needed to constitute for losses when a broker's balance falls beneath the required minimum.

term_179.name: Volatility
term_179.text: The measurement used to describe the fluctuation of the price of a financial instrument over a specific amount of time.

term_180.name: Wire Transfer
term_180.text: The process of transferring money electronically from one financial institution to another.

term_181.name: World Bank Group
term_181.text: A support organization that offers its' technical and financial advice to developing countries worldwide.

term_182.name: Wallet
term_182.text: The place where cryptocurrencies are stored. There are five types of crypto wallets; software wallets, mobile wallets, web wallets, paper wallets, and hardware wallets.

term_183.name: Whipsaw
term_183.text: A sharp price movement being trailed by a sharp repeal.

term_184.name: X
term_184.text: Depicting a mutual fund, this is a NASDAQ stock symbol.

term_185.name: XE
term_185.text: Stands for Xpress Engine. A prominant financial site that provides helpful tools for traders.

term_186.name: XAG
term_186.text: The currency symbol for the precious metal silver. Silver can be used in financial exchanges and typically maintains a high price.

term_188.name: XAU/USD
term_188.text: The gold (XAU) to U.S. dollar (USD) exchange rate can be monitored online and is consistently changing.

term_189.name: Yield Curve
term_189.text: The use of a graph to exhibit the correlation between interest rate and the maturity of the debt asset for a trader.

term_190.name: ZAR
term_190.text: The currency symbol for the South African Rand.

term_191.name: Zero-Bound
term_191.text: When interest rates nearly reach zero percent making it challenging for central banks to measure the expansion of the economy.
